Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the progress of building the wall by implying that construction is underway and that $1.6 billion is being used for it, when in reality, only projects to improve or replace existing fencing are being funded.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that construction of the wall has actually started.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the construction of the wall has begun based on President Trump's statements, without considering the actual facts and funding limitations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no prototype for the border wall has been selected yet, as confirmed by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
Understate: The claim understates the actual progress of the wall by stating that only projects to improve or replace existing fencing are being carried out, rather than the construction of a new border wall.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the photos shared by Trump in his tweet were for the replacement of an existing border wall, rather than the construction of a new one.
